revision.text:
{{Infobox protected area | name = İğneada Floodplain Forests National Park | alt_name = ''İğneada Longoz Ormanları Milli Parkı'' | iucn_category = | photo = İğneadaFloodplainForestsNP (15).JPG | photo_alt = | photo_caption = An [[ivy]]-climbed tree in the floodplain forest. | photo_width = | map = Turkey | relief = yes | map_alt = | map_caption = | map_width = | label_position = right | label = İğneada Floodplain Forests NP | location = [[Kırklareli Province]], Turkey | nearest_city = [[İğneada]], [[Demirköy, Kırklareli|Demirköy]] | coordinates = {{coord|41|49|10|N|27|57|14|E|display=inline,title}} | area = {{convert|3155|ha|acre|abbr=on}} | established = {{start date and age|2007|11|13}} | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | governing_body = Directorate-General of Nature Protection and National Parks
[[Ministry of Environment and Forest (Turkey)|Ministry of Environment and Forest]] | world_heritage_site = | url = }} The '''İğneada Floodplain Forests National Park''' ({{lang-tr|İğneada Longoz Ormanları Milli Parkı}}), established on November 13, 2007, is a [[national park]] located within [[Kırklareli Province]] in [[Marmara Region]] of Turkey. The national park covers an area of {{convert|3155|ha|acre|abbr=on}} and is located at [[İğneada]] town on the Turkish-Bulgarian border at {{convert|25|km|mi|abbr=on}} far from [[Demirköy, Kırklareli|Demirköy]] district of Kırklareli Province. Streams running down from the [[Strandzha]] mountain range towards [[Black Sea]] formed [[alluvium]] on the shore, where [[floodplain]] ({{lang-tr|longoz}}) occurred due to seasonal floodings. The [[protected area]] is administered by the Directorate-General of Nature Protection and National Parks ({{lang-tr|Doğa Koruma ve Milli Parklar Genel Müdürlüğü}}) of the [[Ministry of Environment and Forest (Turkey)|Ministry of Environment and Forest]]. The national park is a rare [[ecosystem]], which consists of [[marsh]], [[swamp]], lakes and coastal sand [[dune]]s. The Strandzha mountain range is situated in the south and west. There are five lakes with [[aquatic plant]]. Lake Erikli covering {{convert|43|ha|acre|abbr=on}} is a [[lagoon]], which gets separated from the sea in the summer months as a result of drought. Lake Mert of {{convert|266|ha|acre|abbr=on}} area is formed by Çavuşdere creek at its mouth. Lake Saka is a small lake of {{convert|5|ha|acre|abbr=on}} situated in the south of the national park between the floodplain and the dunes. The two other lakes are Lake Hamam of size {{convert|19|ha|acre|abbr=on}} and Lake Pedina of {{convert|10|ha|acre|abbr=on}}. The sand dunes are situated on both sides of İğneada town. The dunes in the north stretch out from east of Lake Erikli to İğneada. The southern dunes run from the Lake Mert's sea connection to the south of Lake Saka, reaching a width of {{convert|50|-|60|m|ft|abbr=on}} at some places. ==Ecosystem== ===Flora=== [[File:İğneadaFloodplainForestsNP (10).JPG|thumb|A view from the national park. Trees on the leftside of the trail and typical [[typha]] on the rightside.]] [[File:İğneadaFloodplainForestsNP (11).JPG|thumb|Sandy lakeshore, typha and wood in the background in the national park.]] The {{convert|10|km|mi|abbr=on}} long dunes with the plant species, unique to the southwestern Black Sea region, are of great importance. The flora of dunes in the belt between the lakes, marsh and the sea are under protection by international agreement. The national park is also habitat for swamp and non-evergreen mixed wood. [[Vine]] species are the most distinct plants of the forest. Sprecies of [[European ash]] (''Fraxinus excelsior''), [[oak]] (''Quercus''), [[alder]] (''(Alnus''), [[beech]] (''Fagaceae'') and [[maple]] (''Aceraceae'') are trees found in the national park forest. ===Fauna=== [[Trout]] (''Oncorhynchus''), [[Smelt (fish)|smelt]] (''Osmeridae''), [[Mullet (fish)|grey mullet]] (''Mugilidae'') are fish species of the national park. Birds like [[white-tailed eagle]] (''Haliaeetus albicilla''), [[European green woodpecker]] (''Picus viridis''), [[owl]] (''Strigiformes''), [[grey heron]] (''Ardea cinerea''), [[European cuckoo]] (''Cuculus canorus''), [[kingfisher]] (''Coraciiformes''), [[black stork]] (''Ciconia nigra)'') and [[hoopoe]] (''Upupa epops'') are observed in the area. Among the [[mammal]]s are [[wildcat]] (''Felis silvestris''), [[wild boar]] (''Sus scrofa''), [[hare]] (''Lepus''), [[European pine marten]] (''Martes martes''), [[European badger]] (''Meles meles''), [[grey wolf]] (''Canis lupus''), [[deer]] (''Cervidae''), [[fox]] (''Vulpes vulpes''), [[European otter]] (''Lutra lutra''), [[yellow-necked mouse]] (''Apodemus flavicollis''), [[weasel]] (''Mustela''), [[big-eared bat]] (''Micronycteris''), and [[skunk|variegated skunk]] (''Mephitis mephitis''). As reptiles [[Hermann's tortoise]] (''Testudo hermanni''), [[southern crested newt]] (''Triturus karelinii''), [[lizard]] (''Lacertilia''), [[Vipera aspis|asp]] (''Vipera aspis''), [[Acrochordidae|earringed water snake]] (''Acrochordidae'') are found in the area. ==Access== İğneada Floodplain Forests National Park can be reached by public transportation from [[Istanbul]] via [[Silivri]], [[Çorlu]], [[Lüleburgaz]], [[Pınarhisar]], [[Demirköy, Kırklareli|Demirköy]] and [[İğneada]]. It is convenient to go from Istanbul over the motorway {{TUR-O|3}} via [[Saray, Tekirdağ|Saray]], [[Vize]] and then Poyralı, [[Demirköy, Kırklareli|Demirköy]] and [[İğneada]] by car. ==See also== * [[Lake Saka Nature Reserve]] * [[Acarlar Floodplain Forest]] ==References== {{reflist|30em|refs= {{cite web |url=http://www.milliparklar.gov.tr/mp/igneadalongozormanlari/index.htm |publisher=Doğa Koruma ve Milli Parklar Genel Müdürlüğü |title=İğneada Longoz Ormanları Milli Parkı |language=Turkish |accessdate=2015-05-17 }} {{cite web |url=http://kirklareli.ormansu.gov.tr/Kirklareli/Anasayfa/kirklareli/korunanalanlar/igneadalongozu.aspx?sflang=tr |publisher=Orman ve Su İşleri Bakanlığı-III. Şube Müdürlüğü- Edirne Şube Müdürlüğü |title=İğneada Longoz Ormanları Milli Parkı |language=Turkish |accessdate=2015-05-17 }} }} ==External links== {{National parks of Turkey}} {{commons category|İğneada Floodplain Forests National Park}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Igneada Floodplain Forests National Park}} [[Category:Protected areas established in 2007]] [[Category:National parks of Turkey]] [[Category:Geography of Kırklareli Province]] [[Category:Forests of Turkey]] [[Category:Lakes of Turkey]] [[Category:Floodplains of Europe]] [[Category:Landforms of Kırklareli Province]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in Kırklareli Province]] [[Category:2007 establishments in Turkey]] [[Category:Demirköy District]]
